problem_text:
19.59. Does the group of isometries of Q^3 have a free non-abelian subgroup such that every non-trivial element acts without nontrivial fixed points in Q^3?
The answer is yes if the field of rational numbers Q is replaced by the field R of real numbers (see G. Tomkowicz, S. Wagon, The Banach–Tarski Paradox, Cambridge Univ. Press, 2016.)
J. Mycielski
